Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did you see Oprah yesterday?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I didn't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I, uh... I am going to be a father.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What was Oprah about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Angelina Jolie was on. And she adopted a baby from Asia, and she said that it changed her life. And that really inspired me. So, I want you to look into seeing how much a little Chinese baby would cost.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's a really big decision.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe you should wait before you adopt.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Or not adopt.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just do it, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Roy's sister looked into it, and the application alone costs a thousand dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um... find out if there's a cheaper, less expensive baby out there, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know, she also said the waiting list is like eight months.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Eight months?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't even know if I'll want a baby in eight months.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You probably won't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, Pam? If in ten years, I haven't had a baby, and you haven't had a baby...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Twenty years.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thirty.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's a deal.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: All right. Three pairs of pants. Three pairs of socks. Three packs of condoms.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yesh.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Uh, fun jeans.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right there. Ah.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Sign.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Per diem.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Guess where I am going. I will give you a hint. It is a booze-fueled sex romp, where anything goes. You are correct, sir! I am headed to Philadelphia for the Annual Northeastern Mid-Market Office Supply Convention. And Jim Halpert is going to be coming, which will be fun. Poor little guy. He's been stuck working under Josh, the poor man's Michael Scott, as he is known around my condo.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't be mad, it is a business trip.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: But I don't understand. It's for managers.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Monkey, I am an A. R. M., Assistant Regional Manager.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I know! It... I was just really hoping we could spend some time together. [A long silence.] Are you still there?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, Monkey.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Don't "Monkey" me! You can't wait to get out of here, A. R. M.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: In the Martin family, we like to say, "Looks like someone took the slow train from Philly." That's code for "check out the slut." What is... why are there flies in here?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh my God! Are you so excited for tonight? I am so excited. You guys are going to click, I can feel it. So what are you wearing?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You look so pretty.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, I have a date. He's a cartoonist for the local paper, which is really neat, because I like to draw too. I'm kind of nervous. I haven't been on a first date in nine years... probably shouldn't broadcast that.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, remember, no matter how much you may want to, do not sleep with him on the first date. It gives him all the power.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sleep with who? Whom, whom... whom?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: My neighbor Alan. They're going on a date tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, wow! Oh my God, I have a great idea. You know what you should do to be hilarious? Wear your wedding dress. It would be a great icebreaker.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And your veil.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, do it!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'll probably just wear this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? Okay. Well, word of advice:

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: There's my girl. I noticed you handing out some shekels. How would one get on that train?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: That was for per diem, for Philadelphia.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: That town smells like cheese steaks.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: That town is full of history!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Andrea's the office bitch. You'll get used to her. [introducing himself] Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can I have my neck pillow back? Michael! Can I have my neck pillow back?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Hey, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Josh, how ya doing?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Pretty good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good to see you. There he is! There's the traitor! Traitor! Traitor! Come here, you. Come here! Yeah! The product... the progidal... my son returns.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I was shocked when he told me he was transferring to Stamford. It's like the firemen. You don't leave your brothers behind, even if you find out that there is a better fire in Connecticut.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's really good to see you, man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah! Wow, I didn't expect that. It's good to see you too!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, how's it going up there? Have you made any sales yet?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, sold about forty thousand.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shut up. That's impossible.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, it's not. I did. Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, I did it too.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know, when I saw Dwight, I realized how stupid and petty all those pranks I pulled on him were. And then he spoke. I wonder how hard it would be to get a copy of his room key.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So did you hear?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Pam's back on the market again.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Really? She's dating?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: If I weren't engaged, I would so hit that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So what kind of commissions you get up there?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, Dwight. I've missed you so much.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're so immature!

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Listen, Michael, I heard you were a great salesman.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: And I just want to let you know that if our branch absorbs your branch, I'm going to look for a place for you at Stamford.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, hey!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: We all checked in?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Great, let's dump our stuff and meet back here in half an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Okay!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jan? Look, I think we need to set some ground rules.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The eight-hundred pound gorilla in the room. Carol. I'm still dating her, so nothing can happen between us at the convention.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Step away from me, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you for being so brave with all of this. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Alan's cartoon is so funny, right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: And they're, like, so smart. I don't even know what they mean half the time.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This party is going to be awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know! That is specifically why I chose a room close to the elevator. More foot traffic.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Check it out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is crooked on that side.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey hey!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That is a lot of liquor.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And a dart board.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, that's how we do it in Scranton. Or did you forget? There ain't no party like a Scranton party, 'cause a Scranton party don't stop.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: We should probably head on down and hook up with Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, well, we have time! One for the road, gentlemen?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: A shot of MIDORI, perhaps.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, no, sorry, it's an inside joke. There's this bartender at Stamford who, uh... you know what? You'd just have to be there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wish I was. I love inside jokes. I'd love to be a part of one someday.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Um, we should...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, see you guys down there. Change your mind, come back up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll do a shot, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ugh, that would be gross. It's not even lunch yet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: SWAG! Stuff we all get. I basically decorated my condo for free with all of my SWAG.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Check it out. Hi, I'm Michael Scott, Dunder-Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dwight Schrute, Assistant Regional Manager, Dunder-Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Jerome Bettis
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm a huge fan.

Quote.Speaker: Jerome Bettis
Quote.Text: Thanks. I appreciate it, guys.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? I'm having a huge blowout tonight, Room 308. Hope you can come.

Quote.Speaker: Jerome Bettis
Quote.Text: All right, maybe. If I can.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, cool! Okay, so... can I tell people you're gonna be there?

Quote.Speaker: Jerome Bettis
Quote.Text: No, you cannot.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So maybe. See ya.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why do they call him The Bus?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because he's afraid to fly.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Smile!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you remember me from last year? There's a party in my room, 308, can't miss it, right off the elevator. Tonight. Be there!

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: All right, Jan just emailed me. She wants us to meet her up front.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep. Yeah, she's up front.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You don't have email on your phone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't have to, I just know. Yes, hello?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No one just called you.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right, nice meeting you, Ted. Take care.

Quote.Speaker: Ted
Quote.Text: I'll see you soon.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Yeah, stop by later.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [into phone] See you in a bit. Bye-bye. [to Dwight] May I have a moment of your time please?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I need you to do something for me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes. Anything.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want you to dig up some dirt on Josh. Find out if there are any skeletons in his attic.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll talk to my buddy down at the station, stat.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey! What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's, uh... I was... might ask if you wanted...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [answering phone] Dunder-Mifflin, this is Pam. He's not in the office. Can I take a message? I will. You too. [hangs up] Sorry. What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Um, if, uh... um... I just completely forgot what I was going to say. It's so weird.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. Well, if you think of it, I'll be here.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So I called my buddy down at the station today. Had them run a background check on Josh Porter. See if there's any known aliases, et cetera.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He wasn't volunteering today.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Business has been pretty crazy around the office.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Moved Ryan over to your desk.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, tell him I say hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will call him later with that message.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, how is... Toby?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Toby Flenderson is everything that is wrong with the paper industry. Is he why you left?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, no, it was... you know, a good opportunity for me, a promotion. I got a chance to...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Opportunity, promotion, blah, blah. You know, Jim, those are just words. Have you taken into account other factors, vis-a-vis bosses? Is Josh funnier than I am? Does he even have a girlfriend? Because I have two, basically.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, it's really not a competition.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Jim got us a great lead with a new rep from National Envelope. We can grab lunch with them tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Great!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Jan, Jan? Don't worry, I have got the tip.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Whoa. Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Waiter
Quote.Text: Wow, oh my God, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Was that your per diem?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, that was a different hundred dollar bill.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What have you generated, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have generated a lot of interest in my party this evening.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What party?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The party I'm having tonight in 308. Obviously, you are invited.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael, um... Jim and Josh are in meetings all day. And I am in and out of meetings. I can't stay on top of you 24/7.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You should order the most expensive thing on the menu, so he knows you're worth it.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: If you do that, you're going to have to put out.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. You'll have to put out.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Is there a key for Jane Doe? Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Any messages for 308? All right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey hey, fellers.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Well, Jim and I have a meeting with Uni-ball in about forty-five minutes, so we should probably go now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, check this out. How about that? A little friendly competition. Stamford versus Scranton.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, Jim. Looks like you picked a bad time to defect, my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Fine! All right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay! Excellent. Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Keep the wing flaps.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shut it. [answering phone] Hey, Pam, what's up? Yep, yech... no. Tell him I will give him general specifics tomorrow, okay? Yes. [to others] Say hi to Pam!

Quote.Speaker: Jim, Josh, and Dwight
Quote.Text: Hi, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. That is Josh and Dwight and Jim. [to others] Pam says hi. [into phone] Have fun on your date! Very good, talk to you later. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You first.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on. Nice try, Josh!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not. It hit the rim. Okay, and... okay. Double or nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Or what? We didn't bet anything, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, let's...

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Yeah, we should go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: We gotta go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Uh... we'll do it later.

Quote.Speaker: Evan
Quote.Text: Say, while I have you here, could I talk to you about some new and exciting advances to our product line?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Fine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim and I have different definitions of friendship. I think it's talking and being friends, and Jim thinks it's moving to Connecticut and being best friends with Josh. Well, phooey on that. I, uh, I'm done. I am not going to be speaking with him anymore. Whatevs. Long-distance relationships never work.

Quote.Speaker: Evan
Quote.Text: That is so true. Ready?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, let me tell you what we're looking for.

Quote.Speaker: Evan
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sorry, my meeting ran late.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, Jan, really. With a rep from HammerMill.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: They're exclusive with Staples.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Used to be. Evan will call you in the morning to work out the details. We can now sell HammerMill products.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes! Ha!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, Michael, I underestimated you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, maybe next time you will estimate me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight's room key. And... Dwight's room. What can I say? Old habits die hard.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: D?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God. Dwight got a hooker! Oh my God, I gotta call... well, I gotta call somebody, I don't even know who to call. Dwight got a hooker!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: So, Alan, Pam is obsessed with your cartoons. She reads them every day.

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: Oh, great.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't want ketchup.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You love ketchup! He loves ketchup.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So how do you come up with your cartoons?

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: Well, I just, uh... I kinda think about stuff that I see, or dream them.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You dream in cartoons? How fun!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, first guest! You are going to have some tequila, my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: I thought there was a party in here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is the party.

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: This is room 308?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Party central! So, what can I do you for? [Guy leaves] All right.

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: See, this one is great, because it can work on a couple of different levels.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Huh.

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: [French accent] Freedom fries for the table.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Freedom fries. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: Yeah. I mean, people always say, like, "Don't be edgy." But I don't know any other way. Yeah, you get it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, it was, uh, it was really nice meeting you, Alan.

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: Yeah. Next time bring some of your illustrations, I'll let you pick my brain.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: More freedom fries.

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's great.

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I went on a date. It wasn't a love connection, um... I think when I like someone again, I'll just kinda know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael. Am I the first to arrive?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: People have been filtering in and out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can I get a drink?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can I get a drink?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sure. You like Cosmos?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sure, sounds good. So why are you here? Is Josh busy?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I get it! No, no, I totally get it. He made a better paper airplane, Stamford is better in sales... I get it. We had some fun. We had some laughs. And that's just...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait, wait. I didn't transfer because of you. You're a good boss. You're a great boss.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not better than Josh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, it's not about... I transferred because of Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh my God. You don't even know. She's single now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I just... I heard something about that. It's just, I kind of put it all on the line. Twice, actually. And she said no. Twice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, man. I'm sorry. Hey, you know what? I will talk to her.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope, that's okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's all right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will. I'll talk to her. You should at least talk to Roy. I mean, he knows exactly how you're feeling.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Okay, maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Evan
Quote.Text: Are we early?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! No, you know, people have been filtering in and out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Evan, this is Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How are you?

Quote.Speaker: Evan
Quote.Text: Hey, uh... Arnie Reisman. Michael, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Ernie, how ya doing?

Quote.Speaker: Evan
Quote.Text: Do you guys work together?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, we used to. Now we're friends.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Best friends.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Some people need dozens of friends to say, "Hey, look at me, I'm popular." But not me. I'm very picky. I need three, maybe two. When you meet that someone special, you'll just know. Because a real relationship, it... it can't be forced. It should just come about effortlessly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Now, would you do the pleasure of hitting the lights, sir? [lights go out, leaving Michael's black light on] Ha, ha, ha.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ha, ha, ha, ha.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whoa. What are those stains?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Blood, urine, or semen.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, God, I hope it's urine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Today I'm headed to Philadelphia for the annual Northeastern Office Supply Convention. [makes horns gesture and heavy metal scream] Wooo-yaaaaah! Oh, these things tend to be kind of crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Angela enters Michael's office] Ah.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Sign.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Per-diem. [singing as he signs] Perrrr-diiiiieeeemmmm! [shows off $100 bill to Ryan] You know, Ryan, it's all about the Benjamins.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [reading checklist] Fun jeans.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [points to door] Right there.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Fourth quarter projections for Jan?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. What? Oh, yeah, have Pam give those to me.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Will do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sure you don't want to come?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Gonna be fun! Change your mind we can get you a cot.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [shakes his head]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A couple of years ago, I went to one in Hartford. "Connecticut." And Todd Packer and I went to this bar and met a girl. And [laugh] Packer decides to make out with her. Turns out that her boyfriend is the bouncer at the bar. [laugh] I love this. The bouncer chases us out to Packer's Vette, jump in the Vette, he peels out, and I [laugh] I don't make it to the car. [turns serious] Um, and the other bouncers caught up with me and really did a number on me... It was in the paper... [brightens] But to answer your question, yeah, I'm really excited about this weekend.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: See that factory?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mm-hm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I almost worked there.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yup. Yeah, I applied for a job there.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What would you have done? Been manager?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I was going to be a bottle capper.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You? A bottle capper?! [laughs in disbelief]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, I know. Crazy world. Crazy, crazy world.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Yes, I'm aware of Jan and Michael's... history. Um, I don't really like to talk about it 'cause it's unprofessional. Kind of gross.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Josh reminds me of a guy I went to high school with. Big football star, girls loved him. Whatever. Guess what he's doing now. He's a TV announcer for the Eagles. Up in the... [laughs] He doesn't even get to play in the game, I mean.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So, you ever been convicted of a felony?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: What? Uh, no. [to Jim] Uh, I want you to make sure you call Karen and get her to fax that vendor list over.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Misdemeanor?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Um... When I was in the Coast Guard, a couple of us broke into the women's barracks and we got arrested for trespassing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Coast Guard? So you know how to fight underwater?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: [stunned]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [Jim, Josh, and Jan walk in the hotel lobby] Josh, um... [Jim continues walking ahead] Why don't you come up to my room for a couple of minutes and we can just go over the schedule for tomorrow together.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Can we do it over breakfast? It'll be...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: A quick drink?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Thanks, but maybe another time.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [putting on a good face] Great! [walks off]
